metadata.titleEn: Dataset on the Impact of Grassland Restoration Measures on Plant and Soil Carbon in the Qinghai Tibet Plateau
metadata.description: This dataset includes three parts: (1) The carbon storage of the grassland ecosystem in the Tibetan Plateau from 1981 to 2019; (2) The future trends (2020-2100) of the carbon storage of the Tibetan Plateau grassland ecosystem under different socioeconomic pathways (SSP1-2.6; SSP3-7.0; and SSP5-8.5) without the implementation of NbS projects; (3) The future trends (2020-2100) of the carbon storage of the Tibetan Plateau grassland ecosystem under different socioeconomic pathways (SSP1-2.6; SSP3-7.0; and SSP5-8.5) with the implementation of NbS projects.
metadata.instructions: The data is stored in Excel format, and the file name is "Dataset_Grassland Restoration MeasuresCarbon in the Qinghai Tibet Plateau".

authorList.unitEn: Institute of Tibetan Plateau Research, Chinese Academy of Sciences

literatureList.titleEn: Nature-based Solutions can help restore degraded grasslands and increase carbon sequestration in the Tibetan Plateau
literatureList.referenceEn: Sun, J., Wang, Y., Lee, T., Nie, X., Wang, T., Liang, E., Wang, Y., Zhang, L., Wang, J., Piao, S., Chen, F., & Fu, B. (2024). Nature-based Solutions can help restore degraded grasslands and increase carbon sequestration in the Tibetan Plateau. Communications Earth & Environment, 5, 154. https://doi.org/10.1038/s43247-024-01330-w.

Feature Specification.Question: What features or characteristics are essential when exploring datasets related to the impact of grassland restoration measures on plant and soil carbon in the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau?
Feature Specification.Answer: carbon storage data from 1981-2019, future trends of carbon storage under different socio-economic pathways (SSP1-2.6, SSP3-7.0, SSP5-8.5) without NbS implementation, future trends with NbS implementation

Quantification.Question: What is the time span of the carbon storage data collected for the grassland ecosystems on the Tibetan Plateau?

Causal Antecedent.Question: What factors contribute to the variations in carbon storage estimates in grassland ecosystems on the Tibetan Plateau from 1981 to 2019?
Causal Antecedent.Answer: The variations in carbon storage estimates in grassland ecosystems on the Tibetan Plateau from 1981 to 2019 are influenced by different restoration measures applied to the grasslands, as well as the impact of various socio-economic pathways (SSP1-2.6, SSP3-7.0, and SSP5-8.5) on carbon storage projections for the future (2020-2100).

Causal Consequence.Question: What are the potential effects on the future carbon stock trends in the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau grassland ecosystem when implementing NbS projects under different socio-economic pathways compared to scenarios without such interventions?
Causal Consequence.Answer: Implementing NbS projects in the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau grassland ecosystem can influence future carbon stock trends differently under various socio-economic pathways (SSP1-2.6, SSP3-7.0, and SSP5-8.5). These interventions are likely to alter the carbon storage outcomes compared to scenarios without NbS projects, potentially enhancing carbon sequestration and reducing carbon emissions over the period from 2020 to 2100.

Goal Orientation.Question: What are the main objectives of collecting data on the impact of grassland restoration measures on plant and soil carbon in the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The objectives include understanding the carbon storage changes in the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau grassland ecosystems from 1981 to 2019, assessing future trends of carbon storage without Nature-based Solutions (NbS) interventions under different socio-economic scenarios (SSP1-2.6, SSP3-7.0, and SSP5-8.5) from 2020 to 2100, and evaluating the impact of implementing NbS projects on carbon storage under the same socio-economic scenarios.

Expectation.Question: Why might there be challenges in accurately predicting future trends of carbon storage in the Tibetan Plateau grassland ecosystems under different socioeconomic pathways?
Expectation.Answer: The prediction of future trends in carbon storage in the Tibetan Plateau grassland ecosystems under different socioeconomic pathways (SSP1-2.6, SSP3-7.0, and SSP5-8.5) could be affected by various challenges, including the complexity of ecological responses to socioeconomic changes, the variability in climate models, and the uncertainty in implementing Nature-based Solutions (NbS) projects. These factors can introduce significant uncertainty in the projected outcomes for carbon storage, making it challenging to achieve accurate predictions.
